title: Coronavirus doctor's diary: How the virus has changed our sleep patterns
description: Coronavirus is clearly a virus that affects our nervous system - and it appears to have an impact on the brain's sleep patterns.

title: Sudden death: Partner's heartache after her fiancé died aged 31
description: Danielle Riley shares her grief after losing her partner Andy to Sudden Adult Death Syndrome.

title: Covid Greece: Waiting for the tourists to come back
description: As Europeans wait to see if foreign holidays are possible this summer, Greece hopes to open up soon.

title: Gundecha Brothers: Famous Indian music gurus accused of sexual assault
description: The BBC spoke to several women who have accused three famous classical musicians of sexual abuse.

title: Can celebrities control their image online?
description: Meet the stars who have attempted to police their online presence - from Rami Malek to Beyonce.

title: The Myanmar beauty queen standing up to the military
description: A month ago Han Lay was protesting. Last week she used her pageant speech to criticise the military.

title: Vitamin D: The truth about an alleged Covid ‘cover-up’
description: The vitamin is being studied - but why do some claim evidence is being ignored?

title: Boohoo: Karen Millen skirt had Oasis label covered in pen
description: Joanna Sikora said a skirt she bought from Karen Millen had an Oasis label covered in marker pen.

title: Covid: Croquet clubs 'inundated' during lockdown
description: The UK croquet season begins as clubs see a spike in membership enquiries.

title: Adopting in the age of opioids
description: At 40, Carrie Brady decided to start a family and open her heart to adopting a child in need.

title: Patria y Vida: Cuba's rap battle with dissidents
description: A viral YouTube rap and reggaeton hit called 'Patria y Vida' - 'Fatherland and Life' - has angered Cuba's communist-run government.

title: MOTD2 analysis: Is Jose Mourinho blaming his players for Tottenham's defensive woes?
description: Match of the Day 2's Alan Shearer and Ian Wright pick apart the comments by Tottenham manager Jose Mourinho after a poor defensive showing in their 2-2 draw at Newcastle.

title: Extreme E: How did women and men's performances compare in Desert X-Prix?
description: In a brand new motorsport promoting equality between women and men, how did their performances compare in the first of five X-Prixs?

title: A55 Easter traffic brought to standstill as horse 'breaks down'
description: The equine brought the A55 in Gwynedd to a standstill when its vehicle broke down.

title: Hendry keeping 'expectations down' before Crucible qualifiers
description: Stephen Hendry says he is keeping "expectations down" about his comeback and his only goal is to make the main draw of the World Championship.

title: WSL: Geese invade pitch at Brighton-Manchester United game
description: Several geese stop play at People's Pension Stadium during Brighton's 1-0 win over Manchester United.

title: Dorstone 'illegal rave': Police set up road blocks
description: The community is increasingly concerned about a "large gathering" in Dorstone, police say.

title: Covid: Trials to begin for return of England mass events
description: Ministers also confirm a risk-based "traffic light" system will start when foreign holidays resume.

title: Easter Sunday: Archbishop of Canterbury calls for a better future
description: Justin Welby asks for acts of love, charity and international aid to be continued after Covid.

title: Newtownabbey: Man arrested following second night of violence
description: Thirty petrol bombs were thrown at police and three cars hijacked and set alight in Newtownabbey.

title: Greenwich murder: Woman stabbed to death in block of flats
description: A man is arrested on suspicion of murdering a woman who was found seriously injured in Greenwich.

title: Carabao Cup: Final between Tottenham & Man City to have 8,000 fans in stadium
description: The Carabao Cup final between Tottenham and Manchester City will have 8,000 fans in attendance after it is confirmed as a pilot event to test the return of big crowds.

title: Egypt mummies: Parade transports remains of pharaohs
description: Amid fanfare, 18 kings and four queens were transported on custom-made vehicles designed to minimise vibration.

title: Jordan's Prince Hamzah bin Hussein 'under house arrest'
description: In a video passed to the BBC, Prince Hamzah accuses Jordan's leaders of corruption and incompetence.

title: 'I was convinced the clock was wrong' - Potter runs second-fastest road 5km ever
description: Britain's Beth Potter runs the second-fastest road 5km ever by a female athlete at a race in the Lancashire village of Barrowford.

title: London Zoo: Learning to be a zookeeper during lockdown
description: London Zoo apprentice Joe on how he is learning to be a zookeeper during the pandemic.

title: Bakewell love locks removal plans leave families 'devastated'
description: Plans to remove hundreds of love locks from a Bakewell bridge leaves some families "gutted".

title: The Papers: 'Passport to freedom', and trips abroad 'on track'
description: Many of Sunday's front pages lead with the Covid certificates trial that is due to begin later this month.
